snippet: The need for a bipartisan breakthrough, even a modest one, was amplified by the economic costs wrought by the 16-day shutdown and near-default on government obligations.
abstract: Congressional negotiators plunge into difficult budget talks to avoid repeat crisis within months, and quickly agree to lower their sights from the sort of grand bargain that has eluded the two parties for three years; need for a bipartisan breakthrough, even a modest one, is amplified by economic costs wrought by 16-day shutdown and near-default on government obligations

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: The need for a bipartisan breakthrough, even a modest one, was amplified by the economic costs wrought by the 16-day shutdown and near-default on government obligations.

headline.main: Two Parties Start Work to Avoid Repeat Crisis
headline.print_headline: Two Parties Start Work To Avoid Repeat Crisis
